title: FIDDLE is still AWFUL (go play him 20+ games in Plat+ and report back to me if you disagree)
body:
I don't care if his winrate is nearly 50%; it's certainly not because he's good. It's because the people who play him are very dedicated and have an insane number of average games (more than any other champ).

He's straight garbage though and it's pretty frustrating. His clear is slow as hell and requires massive mana expenditure. He's either squishy or his damage tickles. His ult. has a ton of counterplay via knockbacks, dashes, or just warding. Without ult. he does virtually nothing. He seems like one of the most useless junglers in the game now and only seems effective if his team's already ahead (thus giving you a huge vision + item advantage). I have probably 250+ Fiddle games over the last few seasons and I've never seen him in a more pathetic state. If I go 3-1 on most junglers, I feel like I have a chance to carry. With Fiddle, I still have to hope the enemy team is bad and takes some dumb path into a Fiddle ult.

replies.body: Fiddle honestly needs a rework, IMHO. He's nothing without his ult.

You mean Shaco's? And I meant an AoE fear in Fiddle's kit would be OP unless it was delayed or very conditional. I think it fits Shaco's kit fine in its context though.

He's SITUATIONALLY decent but hardly "good" and again it's mostly dedicated Fiddle players. He is REALLY bad vs strong ganking junglers and stealth is a big issue for him. I was vs an Ekko Mid as Fiddle and Twitch JG just kept coming and I can only place one pink after all. I was forced to farm under turret instead of keeping the lane in the middle with E spam. When Fiddle is pushed in, he will miss a TON of CS under turret. You can probably get 70% but not more so it's a pretty bad situation compared to many other mids. For example, if I'm Kassadin (great vs Fiddlesticks btw) under turret, I can get 100% of CS if I'm not zoned by abilities. It's really easy.  This makes pushing champions like Aurelion Sol quite hard to deal with because they'll clear the wave instantly and just use their massive map pressure to influence the map. If you do the same, you'll have half their CS.  

Basically, I think Middlesticks is better than JG Fiddle IF the matchup is decent but it's still not a good pick. It's way more viable than Fiddlesticks into WW or Udyr (yeah even Udyr shits on him... it's sad) though.
Udyr has a fairly constant single target stun though, so it makes sense he counters him. It would be SOMETHING if Fiddlesticks performed poorly against someone like {{champion:28}}
Probably about every change in the last two years have seemed to be expressly designed to fuck Fiddle over

How? I thought he got some QoL changes along with multiple straight up buffs, and a small compensation nerf to his bounce-count (which was because one of the buffs was too much).

Fiddlesticks is an old champion with an unique play-style, like Singed. And like Singed, has a dedicated playerbase and sure as hell isn't weak when used in the right hands.

Zhonya's repeatedly nerfed, jungle changes make his low tier clear even worse, meta junglers are mobile ads that crush him in the jungle and puts cake him, his itemization is shit, half his kit requires him to stand still when the meta is FAST FAST GO GO GO, the other half requires him to be in the middle of a team as a squishy mage

The jungle changes DESTROYED him, year after year.

Fiddle was one of the few junglers in S5 that didn't need smite. They just went into jg item. Then the jungle items were locked to smite.
Then this year, the changes to camps destroyed what little viability was left.

Riot tried to throw his kit a bone. But it wasn't nearly enough to make him viable in jungle without being oppressive elsewhere.

Fiddle's kit was never the problem. His viability was gutted out from under him with jungle changes.

So pretty much Fiddlesticks is fine, but everybody else is just messed up.
I think that he should get a Warwick-level update to modernize. Because, even though his kit has some of the strongest individual abilities in the game, they are very clunky. 
Keep the core parts of Fiddlesticks intact, while allowing him to keep up with newer designs.

Junglesticks isn't that good, because he can hardly keep up with the annual changes there.
Middlesticks is actually a viable pick if you know what you're doing. Great counterpick against assassins, because of his reliable CC, and assassins don't have CC to interupt his channels. 

One of the worst things about playing Fiddlesticks is his farming. It's very hard! I think he would be a contested pick if he had wave clear. His team fight and skirmishes are both good, but getting that CS, not so much.

Agreed, he needs a full rework.
The only thing I'd like to see maintained is a fear of some sort (SCAREcrow).
His ult is likely fine, but still feels a little old without some other functional changes.

It doesn't help that his kit plays against itself.

His R and W require enemies to be close, but your Q makes them run away and your W forces you to stand still.

Have you ever heard of smurfing? Some people have half a dozen accounts and your comment has literally no bearing on anything of substance regarding Fiddlesticks.

Fiddlesticks feels awful because he's one of the only characters in the game who REALLY needs to disable enemy sight. Fiddlesticks is an insanely useful pick against enemy teams that lack sight or generally he's a useful pick with an allied team that dedicates their time to removing wards from the map. Fiddle is a high threat glass cannon that needs to take the enemy by surprise, and that's why it's really hard to balance him since Sight can be so easily obtained ever since they thought it's a good idea to sell Control Wards for 75 gold.

I don't get the people that call his jungling shit, his crow stacks damage on camps with multiple targets and his W heals him back up to 100% in the blink of an eye. 

You shouldn't pick Fiddlesticks hoping you get a super nice Jungler, he's anything but that, but he sure as heck isn't a terrible Jungler. He just isn't your conventional go-to Jungler like Lee Sin who is allowed to be good at everything. He uses his jungle to refill his health and get back to ganking, it's not his job to hang around at camps for cash.

{{item:1410}} should be your first item, you want to fix Fiddles bad jungle clear by rushing Echoes and Tracker's Knife is especially important because your success depends on sight. Fiddlesticks needs sight more than anyone else in the game. Get {{item:3157}} as your next high cost item to survive a counterattacking during your ultimate, then get {{item:3116}} to oppress the enemy team more with your tools.

People that imply Fiddlesticks is a terrible jungler simply haven't seen a good Fiddle on their elo. The character has more potential than a lot of other meta picks, you just need to understand that map awareness and sight is the most important thing about this character.
